name: Deep Science Ventures
description:
Deep Science Ventures was founded to create a better method for applied science, one that is business-minded and focused on opportunity discovery. Rather than build companies on the back of IP that is hot or on-trend, we start by identifying pivotal problems and crucial opportunities.

Then, our global network of founder-type scientists build “holy grail” ventures that have the potential to redesign entire sectors. 

We are a team of uncompromising scientists at the intersection of scientific expertise and possibility. We are intrinsically driven to leave the world a better place than we found it. After spending 10 years in university tech transfer, venture studios, and corporate innovation arms, we’ve developed a better framework to scale the impact of science.

To learn more or join us, please visit: www.deepscienceventures.com.

team.name: Jose Videira
team.bioHtml: Founder @Synbiosys; Part of Alpha cohort @Deep Science Ventures; PhD in Optics @Imperial College London ; Worked @Duvas Technologies @Deltadot @HydroVenturi

team.name: Eilish Middlehurst
team.bioHtml: Worked at Deep Science Ventures, Project Management  Development.. Experience with Audit, Clinical Research, Dermatology. Went to Robert Gordon's University

team.title: Global Funding Lead
team.name: Javier Noris
team.bioHtml: Founder & VC @ScienceVest (YC F3) • Syndicate early stage frontier tech & life science deals. Board of Directors @LifeExtensionAdvocacyFoundation

team.title: Founder, Director
team.name: Dominic Falcao
team.bioHtml: Founder @Imperial Create Lab, @Deep Science Ventures • Worked at @Imperial Innovations Plc

team.title: Founder, Director
team.name: Mark Hammond
team.bioHtml: Co-founder of Deep Science Ventures which brings together scientists to create high-tech ventures that matter at a global level. Ex-Imperial Innovations & Neuro

jobs.title: Associate Director for Computation
jobs.description:
Building “optimised ventures” to accelerate the next generation computation.
Full time, London (Monument), starting asap


THE ROLE
We’re looking to lead the development of a range of new paradigms in computation, data and connectivity that otherwise won’t emerge any time soon from existing paths. You will be defining where we should build but as a starting point we are particularly interested in:

●  Scalable (low-error) quantum computation
●  Leverage quantum computing in scientific computing and machine learning
●  Neuromorphic computing in machine learning and moving beyond backpropagation
●  Data storage from L1 cache to long term
●  In memory computation
● Automation with one shot learning and shared learning
●  Seamless remote presence
●  Human intelligence augmentation
●  Systems that programme themselves / “no code” / seamless updates
●  Reducing barriers in hardware design and fab (cost, complexity, standards etc. ) 
●  Ultra-high bandwidth and low latency data communication
●  Data centre optimisation, particularly around power and task specific acceleration
●  Security and trust


Key metrics:
●  Number and quality of ventures launched per year (we aim for at least six)
●  Number and quality of partnerships and funding brought to those ventures
 

WHO WE’RE AFTER
The role requires sufficient breadth and depth of insight across the fields bullet pointed above or related fields both in terms of the science and industry dynamics. The ideal person is probably a mix of an academic background, consultancy or start-up experience (founding or early team), a major industry player and perhaps toe in the investment environment, maybe running due diligence or advising several deep computational companies. More than anything we’re looking for you to bring a vision of how you would drive the development of the sector, the current constraints and how to overcome them, an eye for opportunity and the founder type mindset to bring together the right people to make it happen. 


Ideally you’ll have:
●  Background in computation and/or adjacent fields and demonstrated experience working with and progressing projects in complex technical subjects 

●  Experience of working in a startup environment with focus on commercial outcomes

●  Industry insight having worked with one of more of the leading companies in the field or spent time analysing/evaluating the sector

 

WHAT YOU’LL GET
You will be responsible for everything from deciding which opportunity areas we pursue and which partners we bring on board, to selecting founders and directing ventures based on your vision for what the sector should look like in 5-10 years. You will also have the opportunity to work with mature seed stage companies that are already in our portfolio. 

As with other sectors we are already building out key partnerships that provide testbeds, rapid prototyping, specific investment and growth experience and academic partners, whilst carefully avoiding getting caught up in the status quo.  

You’ll be part of an adventurous team that does not compromise on their mission to scale the impact of science + base salary, equity and business development incentives, reporting directly to DSV’s Founding Directors. All Associate Directors are intended to become full Directors at DSV, and we will support your personal development accordingly.

jobs.title: Associate Director for Energy
jobs.description:
Building “optimised ventures” to accelerate the net-zero carbon transition.

Full time, London (Monument), starting asap


ABOUT DSV

DSV is a new paradigm for applied science. We bring together teams of scientists to seize crucial opportunities and redefine industries.
We are a team of uncompromising scientists at the intersection of scientific expertise and possibility. After spending 10 years working in innovation across university tech transfer offices, venture studios and corporate innovation arms, we’ve developed a better framework to scale the impact of science.

DSV is early in its life, but we’ve already proven that we can identify enormous opportunities that others are ignoring and build teams and solutions that incumbents believe are impossible, from living brain machine interfaces and in silico antibody design, to closed battery systems optimisation.


THE ROLE 

We're looking for an entrepreneurial engineering science enthusiast to join our team and continue building out our ​thesis for venture creation in energy​. Everything from deciding on which opportunity areas we go after and which partners we bring on board to selecting founders and launching ventures will be directed by your vision for what the sector should look like in 5-10 years.

Key metrics:
● Number and quality of ventures launched per year (we aim for at least six)
● Number and quality of partnerships and funding brought to those ventures
 

WHO WE'RE AFTER

The role requires sufficient breadth and depth of insight across energy related fields both in terms of the science and industry dynamics. First-hand startup experience is ideal (either as a founder or part of an early team at a startup), although we're open to other evidence that demonstrates opportunity-driven mindset, ambition and other founder-type characteristics.

Ideally you'll have:
● Background in engineering science or similar disciplines (e.g. PDEng, MIChemE, MSc or PhD in physics, nuclear engineering, biophysics, etc.)
● Experience in working in startup environment with focus on commercial outcomes
● Industry insight having worked with leading energy companies or spent time analysing/evaluating the sector


WHAT YOU'LL GET
You'll be part of an adventurous team that does not compromise on their mission to scale the impact of science + base salary, equity and business development incentives.


CONTACT
For further info and to discuss the role, email Santa Astratova via​ santa@dsv.io
